Primary Contact: Jen Paquette, Youth Housing Support - Kelowna; Phone: 778.214.4131; Email: jpaquette@boysandgirlsclubs.ca
Service Details: - Works with youth ages 16-24 to help prevent homelessness and move youth who are experiencing homelessness into housing with additional services and supports as needed- Focuses on youth's strengths and helps them build life skills and connections to enable them to live independently- Assists youth to access income supports, re-engage in successful education, set career goals, access employment and training, engage meaningfully in the community through volunteering, attending special events or engaging in recreational opportunities- Accompanies youth to meetings with landlords and/or potential roommates, provides information and support in accessing community resources, including information on tenants’ rights and responsibilities, and teaches housing independence skills- Offers follow-up aftercare support for housed youth who need assistance to maintain housing or gain life skills to succeed in their tenancy
How to Apply: Please call the Youth Housing Support Worker for an application
Former Name: Central Okanagan Boys and Girls Club
